The 'Chemical Biological Incident Response Force' (CBIRF) is a unit in the
United States Marine Corps responsible for countering the effects of a chemical,
biological, radiological, nuclear, or high-yield explosive (CBRNE) incident.
They were activated in April 1996 by General Charles C. Krulak, then Commandant
of the Marine Corps. The unit is based at Naval Support Facility in Indian Head,
Maryland and fall under the command of the II Marine Expeditionary Force.
categories: Military units and formations of the United States Marine Corps
